texts.es: jose de 35 años de edad vive con su esposa y 3 miembros mas de su familia, se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol, solicita un credito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros que le servira para incrementar sus ventas y poder llevar el sustento diaria a su familia.
texts.en: Jose is 35 years old. He lives with his wife and 3 other family members. He works growing corn and beans. He is requesting a loan which will permit him to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, and pesticides, among other items which will help him increase his sales, so that he can provide daily sustenance to his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farm.

loans.name: Santos Manuela

texts.es:
La señora Santos Manuela esta soltera, tiene 42 años de edad, curso los 6 años de educacion primaria, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales 1 esta estudiando, ella tiene una tienda de productos de consumo diario, inicio este negocio con sus padres y hasta el momento lleva 11 años de experiencia en ese negocio.

Solicita un prestamo que lo utilizará para la compra de mercaderia de productos de consumo diario para su tienda, en el futuro quiere contar con una abarroteria.
texts.en:
Santos Manuela is single and 42 years old. She completed 6 years of primary education. She has 2 children, one of whom is in school. She has a store where she sells basic staple products. She started this business with her parents, and as of now she has 11 years of experience with the business.

She is requesting a loan which she will used to buy basic staple products as merchandise for her store. In the future, she would like to have a large grocery store.

loans.use: to buy basic staple products to sell.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Amie is 44 years old, married, and has seven children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for 20 years, and she earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing (RTW). 

Amie is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream -- to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Emierose

texts.en:
Emierose is 29 years old, married, and has two children, who are in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Emierose has been farming sugarcane for four years, and she has borrowed seven times from NWTF in the past, to sustain her activity.

Emierose would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, a 61-year-old married mother of three, has been buying and selling livestock in the Philippines for 10 years now. Having borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business, she is requesting a new loan of PHP 22000 to buy additional livestock to sell.

In the future, Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир выращивает овощи на своем участке в селе Великая Знаменка. Этим бизнесом он занимается уже 28 лет. На данный момент он живет с женой и младшей дочерью в своем доме. Доход с огорода составляет около 130 000 гривен. Выращивает он в основном помидоры, огурцы, редис и виноград. У Владимира – большое хозяйство, он все делал сам. Видно, что он знает цену деньгам. 
Этой зимой из-за сильного снегопада завалило одну теплицу, которую теперь надо срочно восстанавливать. Владимир помнит, как в ту ночь он почти не спал, боялся, что может завалить теплицы. Сначала все было нормально, но под утро одна из них не выдержала и рухнула, теперь для ее реконструкции понадобились дополнительные средства. Владимир планирует использовать 24 000 гривен, собранных на КИВА, для того, чтобы подготовить теплицу к весне и началу сезона. У Владимира много свободной земли, со временем он планирует построить еще несколько теплиц, потом сделать в них отопление.
texts.en: Vladimir grows his vegetables on his own land in the village of Velikaya Znamenka.  This has been his business for 28 years.  Currently, he lives with his wife and youngest daughter in the home they own.  The income from his garden is around 130,000 grivens.  He mostly grows tomatoes, cucumbers, radishes and grapes.  Vladimir's farm is large, and he does everything himself.  It's clear that he understands the value of money.  This winter, heavy snowfall caused one of his greenhouses to collapse and it now urgently needs to be restored.  Vladimir remembers the night it happened, he didn't sleep for fear the structures couldn't withstand the weight of the snow.  At first, everything was fine, but in the morning it became apparent that he was right.  Now he needs funds to rebuild it.  He plans to use 24,000 grivens from Kiva to prepare the greenhouse for spring and the beginning of the season.  Vladimir has a lot of free land.  With time, he plans to build several more greenhouses, and then to install a heat source in them.

loans.use: to rebuild his greenhouse.

loans.name: Flor De Ñustas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE ÑUSTAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por doce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Amalia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de jugos de linaza, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, costura de chamarras, costura de ropa, artesanía en chicotes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Amalia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía en chicotes (látigos andinos); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de un tío que trabajaba en este rubro.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cuero) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene ocho hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta el ahorro y las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The "Flor de Ñustas" communal bank will begin their first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana regional office. This group is made up of twelve members and is run by a board of directors, of which Amalia is the president. The members of this communal bank work in a variety of businesses, such as selling flaxseed juice, a neighborhood store, selling food, making jackets, making clothing, and making artisan whips.

This loan will benefit small business owners such as Amalia. She says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer, which she joined by the invitation of one of the institution's consultants who visited her at home. She currently has an artisan crafts business, making "chicotes" (Andean whips). She says that she learned about this business years ago from one of her uncles, who worked in this field.

She will use this loan to increase her capital by buying leather, which she will acquire from stores in the city of La Paz. After making her products, she will sell them in her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home as much as possible. She lives in a common-law marriage and has eight children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the savings and the workshops on health and loans.

loans.use: to buy leather.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Batbayar is 35 years old and lives with his 5-year-old son in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia.  He and his son reside in a ger on his father’s yard.  A ger is a traditional, portable, Mongolian dwelling.  He has been providing taxi services to local people since 2005 and he knows when and where to pick up customers.

Because he is divorced, he is the only one taking care of his son.  Each passing day, the needs of his son are increasing and, at the same time, he is working even harder than before.  He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase a natural gas vehicle, which is better suited for taxi service compared to his previous one.  Having a high quality, fuel-efficient automobile is a necessary tool for his taxi service.  The borrower is a very hardworking individual who cares deeply for his son.

loans.use: to purchase a natural gas automobile for his taxi service.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pottery business in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her pottery.
Nena has been in this business for 35 years. Nena earns additional income from a general store.
Nena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

loans.name: Lory

texts.en:
Lory is 35 years old, married, and has one child, who is currently in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to pay laborers' wages and to purchase fertilizers for her sugarcane. Lory has been farming sugarcane for four years, and she has borrowed seven times from NWTF in the past, to sustain her activity.

Lory would like to save enough money for future expansion of her business.

loans.use: to pay laborers' wages and to buy fertilizers for her sugarcane

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: This new loan of PHP 22,000 is Gloria's ninth loan from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. and she plans to use it as rolling capital, initially buying more materials needed for her pottery business. Gloria would like to save enough money so she could have a secure future and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna works hard to support her family. Rosanna is married and has a rug making business in the Philippines.
Rosanna requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials needed for her business.
Rosanna has been in this business for 2 years now.
In the future, Rosanna would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials needed to make rugs.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 33 years-old and married with two children.

Jonalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy items to sell including canned goods, soap, spices, snack foods, etc..

Jonalyn has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Jonalyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell including canned goods, soap, spices, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto Carlos es originario del municipio de El Sauce, es un joven de 32 años, padre de familia que desde muy pequeño le enseñaron el amor al trabajo.

Inició trabajando en un tricitaxis brindando servicio a los pobladores de dicho municipio y sus visitantes y al paso de los años, el esfuerzo de su trabajo hoy tiene siete tricitaxis los cuales los alquila para este tipo de servicio.

El tricitaxis en este poblado es una especie de taxi la cual es una bicicleta con un asiento por delante donde se sienta el pasajero para llevarlo a las diferentes partes del municipio de El sauce.

Está solicitando un crédito para comprar dos Tricitaxis, ya que la demanda de este servicio ha crecido y actualmente no cuenta con este capital para poder hacer su inversión.

Pide ayuda a los inversionistas de Kiva que le apoyen con este financiamiento a través de Ceprodel para poder llevar a cabo su objetivo, ya que estos préstamos son de gran ayuda para los pequeños comerciantes.
texts.en:
Roberto Carlos is from the municipality of El Sauce. He is a 32-year-old father who was taught to love work from a very young age.

He started working in the pedicab business by offering his services to inhabitants and visitors in his municipality. Over the years, he has put effort into his work and he now has seven pedicabs which he rents out for this type of service.

In this town, pedicabs are a type of taxi made of a bicycle with a seat in the back, where the passenger sits in order to travel to different parts of the municipality of El Sauce.

Roberto Carlos has applied for a loan to buy two pedicabs, because the demand for this service has grown and he does not currently have the capital to make this investment.

He is asking for help from Kiva lenders to support him with this loan through Ceprodel so that he can accomplish his goal, because these loans are of great help to small business owners.

loans.use: to buy two pedicabs.

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en: Mrs. Altantuya is 45 years old and lives with her husband and four-year-old daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Her husband is an electrician and gem cutter but currently unemployed. She herself has been working as a chairman at one branch of a building company. Also she rents a 54-square-meter field to a cosmetic product selling company. The house the family lives in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair. So she is requesting a loan of 2,600,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as fiberglass, bricks, concrete and planks. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable and warm place. In addition, the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution by emitting less smoke. The borrower is a very hardworking and trustworthy individual who cares deeply for her family.

loans.use: to purchase insulation and building materials such as fiberglass and bricks to repair their home.

loans.name: Sernalin

texts.en:
Sernalin works hard to support her family. She is married and has a salt retail business in the Philippines.
Sernalin requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of salt to sell.
She has been in this business for five years.
In the future, Sernalin would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of salt to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supplement her assortment of goods by buying picture frames, albums, barrettes and hair clips, artificial flowers, balloons and greeting cards.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena works hard to support her family. Nena is a widow and has a business selling fermented fish (guinamos) in the Philippines.

Nena has requested a PHP 24500 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy ingredients to make fermented fish.

She has been in this business for twenty years.

In the future, Nena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make her fermented fish.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 51 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Regina has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Regina has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy ingredients and utensils for her restaurant.

Regina has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Regina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for her restaurant.

loans.name: 03.05.05-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thảng works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock and cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Mrs. Thảng is 40 years-old and she is married with one child.

She is the group leader of the 03.05.05-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

Her child is grown up so Thảng lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thảng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thảng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thảng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thảng hopes for her child to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock and cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 51 years old. She is married with eleven children and four of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rosie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rosie requested a loan of PHP 16000 amount through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy more fish and other sea food to sell to customers.

Rosie has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and and other sea food to sell to customers.

loans.name: 03.05.06-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hòa works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

Hòa is 55 years old and is married with 1 child.
Hòa is the group leader of the 03.05.06-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 3 members.
Her child is grown so Hòa lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa City, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hòa’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Hòa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main harship that Hòa faces in her business is the lack of capital.
With her business profits, Hòa hopes for her child to find a good job, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 61 years old, married with 4 children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.
Teresita has a general store in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more items like bread, biscuits, soft-drinks and other miscellaneous items.
Teresita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like bread, biscuits, soft-drinks and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Avirmed

texts.en: Mrs. Avirmed, 60 years old, lives with her husband and son in Dornod, the easternmost province of Mongolia. She and her husband both have retired from work and get pensions from the state. Her son has been rendering taxi services to local people for a long time. This year, she and her family purchased a house which needs some repair. So she is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as bricks, cements and planks. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable and warm place where they will burn less coal thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution by emitting less smoke. The borrower is a very hardworking individual even though she is older. She and her husband sometimes run a livestock selling business, because they are eager to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as planks, bricks and cements to repair their home.

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru:
Галина занимается выращиванием овощей в теплицах на своем участке в селе Великая Знаменка уже 23 года. Вместе с мужем и сыном они занимаются фермерским хозяйством. Доход с огорода составляет в среднем 120 000 гривен. На своей земле Галина выращивает помидоры, огурцы и редис. Всю жизнь Галина прожила в селе, работала на ферме дояркой, потом в столовой совхоза, и лишь, когда не стало работы, стала серьезно заниматься огородом. 
Галина обратилась за дополнительной финансовой помощью к КИВА, так как в том сельскохозяйственном сезоне ей нужно было установить котел для отопления, который стоит 17 000 гривен. Благодаря установленному котлу удастся провести отопление на весь огород. Со временем Галина мечтает сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en: Galina has grown vegetables in greenhouses on her own land in the village of Velikaya Znamenka for 23 years.  She, her husband and son all help out with the farming duties.  The income from their garden is around 120,000 grivens.  They grow tomatoes, cucumbers and radishes.  Galina has lived her whole life in Velikaya Znamenka, once working on a farm as a milkmaid, then in the cafeterias of state farms, and only began seriously farming her own land when she could find no more work.  She has turned to Kiva for financial assistance since during the growing season, she needed to install a boiler for heat which costed 17,000 grivens.  Thanks to the installed boiler, the whole garden can be heated.  In time, Galina dreams of remodeling her home.

loans.use: To install a boiler to heat her greenhouses.

loans.name: José De La Paz

texts.es:
En la fotografia aparece el señor José junto a su esposa María.

José tiene 57 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene un hijo; pero no vive con èl. Desde hace unos 8 años trabaja como comerciante; en un inicio ellos trabajaban en otro domicilio, pero la venta se les fue bajando y no le hera rentable; por lo que decidieron vender la propiedad en donde vivian y se fueron para otro lugar de mayor trafico; debido a eso instalaron su negocio nuevamente que consiste en la venta de tostadas de platano y semilla de marañon.

Ellos se trasladan tres veces por semana al mercado de la ciudad que esta a veinte kilometros de su casa a comprar el plátano y la semilla de marañon, aceite y bolsas plásticas para almacenar la semilla y el plátano. En cuanto a la semilla, la compran en grandes cantidades y la almacenan; ya que es fruto de temporada y tienen que almacenar bastante para satisfacer la demanda en todo el año. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundaión Campo, es para comprar mayor cantidad de semilla de marañon. Debido a que la esposa de José, estuvo enferma se quedaron sin efectivo para comprar la semilla que es este el tiempo en que hay producción de este fruto seco; por eso es que necesitan el dinero para comprar bastante. José vende la semilla al interior de los autobuses del transporte colectivo y su esposa vende en las paradas de autobuses. 

Su deseo es solventar todas su deudas, debido a que obtuvo una deuda para construir la casa en que actualmente viven. Además, de tener una vida más tranquila, pues él es exmiltar.
texts.en:
The photograph shows José together with his wife María.

José is 57 years old. He has a common-law wife, and he has one son, but he does not live with him. For about 8 years, he has worked as a merchant. At first, they worked at another house where they lived, but sales were declining and it was not profitable. Therefore they decided to sell the property where they were living, and they went to another place with more traffic. Due to this, they set up the business once again, which consists of selling fried plantains and cashew nuts. 

They travel three times a week to the city's market, which is 20 kilometers from their home, to buy plantains, cashews, oil and plastic bags to store the nuts and the plantains. Regarding the nuts, they buy them in large quantities and store them, since they are a seasonal product and they have to store quite a lot in order to satisfy the demand throughout the year. 

The loan that he is requesting from the Campo Foundation is to buy a greater quantity of cashews. Since José's wife has been sick, they found themselves without cash to buy the nuts, although it is the production season for this crop. Thus, they need the money in order to buy a lot. José sells the nuts inside the local buses, and his wife sells at the bus stops.

His desire is to pay off all his debts, since he obtained a loan to build the house in which they currently live, and to have a quieter life, since he is a former military man.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Salamat

texts.ru: Саламат 58 лет, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. дети на заработках в России. С 2009 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 20,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, в хозяйстве Саламат имеется 10 голов овец и 2,5 га обрабатываемой земли, где ежегодно сажает  фасоль.Доходы от перепродажи скота и от сельского хозяйства составляют примерно 150,000 сом (KGS) в ежегодно. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Саламат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на приобретения 5 овец для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Саламат планирует вложить в увеличение хозяйства, планирует построить большой сарая для животных.
texts.en: Salamat is 58 years old, married and raised 4 children who are currently working in Russia.  Since 2009, Salamat has farmed and worked with livestock, having started her business with 20,000 KGS.  Today, under her stewardship, she has 10 sheep and 2.5 hectares of arable land where she grows beans.  The income from selling livestock and her vegetables is around 150,000 per year.  With the goal of further developing her business, Salamat has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 20,000 KGS to buy 5 sheep that she can fatten and sell.  She plans on using the income from the loan to improve her farm as well as to build a barn for the animals.

loans.use: To purchase 5 sheep

loans.name: Umeda

texts.ru: Умеде 28 лет. Она добрая и целеустремленная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 маленьких детей. Дети Ибодатхону 4 года и Исмоилджону 3 года. Умеда после замужества начала искать подходящую работу, так как она окончила Таджикский Государственный Университет по специальности Экономиста. Все ее усилия оказались напрасно, то есть она не нашла подходящею работу. Она очень обрадовалась, когда узнала о курсе «Добейся успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она очень успешно участвовала на этом курсе и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать свой бизнес купле продажей женского белья в торговом центре. Она с бизнесом будет справляться сама, так как ее муж Бахром, строитель и имеет много дел. Она запрашивает займ в сумме 3000 долларов США для покупки женского белья, чтобы организовать свой бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Umeda is twenty eight years old.  She's a very kind and determined woman.  She's married and is raising two little children, Ibodathon is four, and Ismoiljon is three.  After becoming married, Umeda started to look for work in her field since she graduate from Tajik State University where she majored in economics.  Her efforts were in vain.  She was very excited to find out about the course "Bring It On" offered by the Association of Business Women.  She successfully participated in the course and received a certificate.  She wants to start her own business, buying and selling women's underwear at a mall.  She is the sole proprietor of her business since her husband Bajrom works in construction and is very busy.  She's asking for a loan of 3000 American dollars to buy women's underwear in order to start her own business.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy women's underwear to start a new business

loans.name: Kanyshai

texts.ru: Канышай проживает в одном из сел на родине Манаса. Как и многие семьи в сельской местности, Канышай с мужем откармливают скот и занимается полеводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, Канышай содержит 1 корову и 3 голов овец в своем хозяйстве. В собственности  Канышай имеется 1,0 га земли  где она ежегодно сажает картошку и фасоль что позволяет зарабатывать для семьи около 120,000 сом ежегодно. В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Канышай обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку ГСМ и семян. Доходы Канышай планирует вложить в постройку большого сарая для скота.
texts.en: Kanyshai lives in one of the villages of the Manas region of Kyrgyzstan.  Like many families in rural areas, Kanyshai and her husband work with livestock and in farming.  They started their business with 10,000 KGS.  Today, they have one cow and three sheep in their stewardship.  Kanyshai owns one hectare of land where she grows potatoes and beans every year.  These crops earn the family around 120,000 each year.  With the goal of further expanding her business, Kanyshai has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 30,000 KGS to buy seeds and fuel for her tractor.  She plans on building a large barn for her animals with the income from the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fuel for her tractor.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 39 years old and married. She is engaged in a hog fattening business, as a source of income. She has been managing her hog raising business for over three years. She is a very patient and industrious mother. She operates her livelihood to provide all the needs of her family. It is quite difficult, but her determination to lift her family from poor living pushes her to execute this work. Now she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs. She wants to develop her hog fattening business more, to earn higher profits.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for hogs

loans.name: Ajaasuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Ajaasuren is a 37-year-old widow who lives with her two children in a ger in Mongolia's Uvs province. Her son Amarjargal, age 12, and daughter Mandah, age 14, are local secondary school students.

Ajaasuren, who has been running various types of businesses in the last few years, is just starting her small consumer goods retail business at a rental counter in the local market. She is now requesting 2,000,000MNT to purchase starting inventory for that enterprise.

A hardworking, diligent and responsible woman, Ajaasuren says, "My children will soon be university students and I need to cover their advanced education costs."

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her new consumer goods retail business.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa was born in 1968. She has two children, who are learning at university and high school. Her husband is a farmer and earns about 2,500,000 VND per month. Hoa is a food seller. Her income is about 3,500,000 VND. She has done this job for five years. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2004. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 11,990,000 VND to buy tables and chairs for her food stall. She always wants to let her children go to school, until university.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her food stall.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 30 years old, married, and has two children who attend to school. She is selling vegetables to the people in her village. She usually earns about PHP 5,000 each month, in her business. Eden has patiently managed her business, for eight years. 

Now, she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy beans, eggplant, tomatoes and squash, to resell. Eden hopes to keep extending good service to all her customers, which will help her to acquire good profits for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy beans, eggplant, tomatoes and squash, to resell

loans.name: Ligia Aurelia

texts.es:
Ligia Aurelia es una mujer luchadora y fuerte, originaria del municipio de El Sauce, madre de tres hijos todos en edad escolar. 

Desde que quedó viuda aún muy joven  se ha esforzado por sacar adelante a sus hijos y hace 25 años inició su negocio como una pequeña comidería, hoy en la actualidad tiene un cafetín con todas las condiciones para atender a la población en general así como sus visitantes donde ofrece comida rápida y a la carta.

Cuenta con la ventaja que está en el centro de dicho municipio y sus clientes visitan a menudo porque es favorable la comida, sabrosa y por la amabilidad de su dueña.

Cabe señalar que tiene el apoyo de sus hijos quienes trabajan en conjunto con ella.

Está solicitando un crédito para comprar carne, pollo, gaseosas, verduras, condimentos, ya que la demanda de sus clientes ha crecido por lo que necesita elaborar más comida para satisfacer la demanda de los mismos.

Confía en Dios que su solicitud sea aprobada y que los inversionistas de Kiva y Ceprodel le apoyen con este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Ligia Aurelia is a strong, hardworking woman.  She is from the town of El Sauce and mother of three school age children.  She was widowed when she was still very young, and has strived to get her children ahead.  

She started her business, a small café, twenty-five years ago.  Today, she has a small, fully equipped café where she offers fast food and à la carte items to the general population as well as visitors.   She has the advantage of being in the town center and her customers visit often because the food is tasty and delicious, and the owner is friendly.  It is worth mentioning that she has the support of her children who work with her.

She is requesting a loan to purchase meat, chicken, soda, vegetables, and seasoning because customer demand has grown and she needs to make more meals to satisfy this demand.  She trusts in God that her application will be approved and that the Kiva and Ceprodel investors will help her with this funding.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, soda, vegetables, and seasoning.

loans.name: Zulbayar

texts.en:
Mrs. Zulbayar, 29 years old, lives with her family in Dornod, the easternmost province of Mongolia. In 2007, she began working as a machinist at a heat and power plant, and since that time she has been promoted to the fifth level of machinist rankings. Her father runs a privately-owned business. Her younger brother works in Turkey, on an employment contract, and he sends her financial aid each month.

The family's house has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair. So, Zulbayar is requesting a loan of 6,500,000 MNT to purchase hardwood flooring, lumber, vacuum-insulated windows, cement, bricks and wallpaper. After the repairs financed by the loan, the family will live in a comfortable, warm place. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, thus contributing to Mongolia's efforts against air pollution by emitting less smoke. In addition, at this time of year the prices of building materials reach their lowest level. Purchasing them now will save a lot of money. The borrower is a very hard-working individual, who is known in her organization for her politeness and generosity.

loans.use: to purchase building materials, such as planks, cement and bricks, for repair and energy efficiency of her family's home

loans.name: Emely

texts.en: Emely, 42, operates a hog fattening business. She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000. She will use the funds to buy at least two piglets, and then resell these in the market after four months. With the loan, she expects an increased income. She is sure that she will be able to save for her four children’s education, through her hard work and patience.

loans.use: to buy at least two piglets to raise for four months and resell

loans.name: Julio Alejandro

texts.es: don Julio vive con su hijo y es una persona responsable, honesta y trabajadora, tiene un negocio de produccion de ladrillos gracias a este trabajo es como él puede costear sus gastos personales y el de su hijo, con todo el deseo de hacer crecer su negocio solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en la compra de materiales como barro leña y tierra para poder elaborar los ladrillos.
texts.en:
Julio lives with his son and is a responsible, honest and hardworking person.  He has a business making bricks, and this is what enables him to cover his personal expenses and his son's expenses.  

He strongly wishes to grow his business and is thus seeking a loan so that he can invest in materials such as clay, soil and firewood that he will use to make bricks.

loans.use: to buy materials used for making bricks.

loans.name: Badamjav

texts.en:
Mrs. Badamjav is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters. They live in a house in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband, Tumenbayar, works at a local school as a teacher. Her daughters are students: Bolortuya, age 18, is a freshman at university, and Baljinnyam, age 11, goes to a local school.

Borrower has been running a business, selling clothing in a local market, since 2000. She has gained lot of experience in dealing with customers and suppliers. She is now starting a tailoring service business at home. She requests 4,000,000 MNT, to purchase an electric sewing machine and inventory for her new tailoring business. She is a hard-working, honest, diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase an electric sewing machine and inventory for her new tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase staple goods.

loans.name: Rosainne

texts.en:
Rosainne is 28 years old and married. She has three children. She needs to earn income for her family. She engaged herself in a business where she sells groceries. She does it daily and earns an amount of PHP 200 a day. She uses this to buy things they use every day, such as rice and viands.

Now she is asking for a loan, in the amount of PHP 10,000, to buy additional groceries and products to resell, such as biscuits, toothpaste, toothbrushes, breads, and vegetables. She hopes she could then earn higher than her usual income.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to resell, such as biscuits, toothpaste, toothbrushes, breads, and vegetables

loans.name: Dilcia Angelica

texts.es:
Dilcia es una mujer joven de 24 años de edad casada que junto a su esposo procrearon 3 hijos el mayor tiene una edad de 12 años, el segundo tiene 7 años y el ultimo 6 meses de nacido los cuales dependen de ellos y los dos mayores ayudan en las actividades del campo y con las actividades del hogar. Ella aprendió la actividad del cultivo y siembra de café, hortalizas como ser: Chile, Pepino, tomate y otros a muy temprana edad debido a que ella no pudo estudiar la primaria completa. Ella tiene un grado de educación cursado hasta segundo grado y no pudo continuar por la falta de recursos por parte de sus padres ya que ellos son muy humildes y no tenían la capacidad económica para ayudarle. Esta actividad que en familia emprenden es el único sustento para su familia y diariamente trabajan duro para cubrir las diferentes necesidades como se: Vestimenta, Alimentos, Medicinas con muchas restricciones, etc. Las tierras donde cultivan les queda a una distancia de un kilómetro de su casa de habitación por lo cual se trasladan a pie diariamente y les permite darle el mantenimiento a sus cultivos y la atención para evitar que estos sean contaminados y deteriorado por los diferentes animales y plagas que existen a los alrededores.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, para sus cultivos de hortaliza. Su sueño es poder incrementar sus cultivos y poder aumentar la cantidad que tiene para obtener mejores ingresos para su familia de esa forma poder darle a sus hijos una mejor educación, un mejor nivel de vida y puedan conseguir buenos empleos.
texts.en:
Dilcia is a 24-year-old woman who is married and lives with her husband and three children.  The oldest child is twelve, the second is seven, and the third child is six months old.  The children depend on their parents, and the two older siblings help in the fields and in the household chores.

At a very early age she learned how to grow chili peppers, cucumbers, tomatoes and other crops.  She was not able to continue her education past the second grade due to lack of resources on the part of her parents, since they are of very humble means and did not have the financial capacity to support her.

Farming is the sole activity that sustains her family.  Every day they work hard to cover the basic necessities such as food, clothing and medicine.  The land that they cultivate is one kilometer from their house, so they go on foot daily to take care of their crops and ensure that they are not contaminated or damaged by the various animals and diseases found in the area.

Currently she is seeking support in order to buy fertilizer and compost for her crops.  Her dream is to be able to expand her fields and her harvests in order to increase her family's income.  In this way she will be able to provide her children with a better education and a better quality of life so that they will be able to get good jobs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost for her vegetables.

loans.name: Jessies

texts.en:
Jessies is a housekeeper, who is married and has four children attending school. She also operates a small store, where she sells grocery items to the people in her village. She wants to offer more products and increase her income, but she has insufficient funds.

Jessies is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy soft drinks, eggs, bread and noodles, to sell in her store. She promises to pay her loan on time and to keep improving her business's sales, so she will be able to save funds for her children’s education and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, bread, and noodles, which she will resell in her store

loans.name: Battumur

texts.en:
Mr. Battumur, 35 years old, lives with his family in Dornod, the easternmost province of Mongolia. His wife holds the position of instructional manager at a high school, where she has worked for four consecutive years. Battumur has been working as a furnace man at a heat and power plant for 13 years, and he is considered to be one of the most experienced and valuable workers at the plant, by his colleagues.

He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials, such as bricks, cement and planks, which he will use to repair the barn. Because the barn is connected to the main house, its vulnerable walls and ceiling are the main reason for the freezing cold in the house. After repair of the barn, the house will not lose its heat from the door side. The repairs, financed with the loan, will enable the family to burn less coal, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution by emitting less smoke. The borrower is a very hard-working individual, who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for making his house less vulnerable to freezing cold weather.

loans.name: Otgonbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Otgonbaatar, 32 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) on his relative's yard. His wife works as a cook at a restaurant. Since 2011, he has been providing transportation services using his own truck between Ulaanbaatar and other cities. Before this business, he had been working as a driver at a private business. His son goes to elementary school and is in the fourth grade. Recently he purchased a second-hand natural gas vehicle that needs some parts updated and changed. Also, his home lacks some necessary daily-use appliances. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to cover the costs of purchasing home appliances such as a vacuum cleaner, a washing machine, and a sofa, as well as spare parts for his automobile. As a result, his family can live in a more comfortable place and he can work enthusiastically. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances and spare parts for his truck

loans.name: Rosa Delia

texts.es: rosa delia de 51 años vive junto a su compañero de vida en casa propia, ella se dedica a la  venta de ropa, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha dado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, quere realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar mas mercaderia. rosa delia tiene buenas referencias de pago, a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Rosa Delia is 51 years old and lives with her life partner in her own home. She sells clothes. She has been running this business for several years and it has given her a lot of sales experience. This has enabled her to obtain very good earnings, but she wants to make a new investment. She does not have enough capital to support this investment and for this reason she is requesting a loan with which she will be able to buy more merchandise. 

Rosa Delia has good payment references and believes that this will allow her to give her family a better life.

loans.use: with her working capital

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José  es un hombre de 40 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe, José tiene un pequeño hijo de 5 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la ida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, José no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Mecánica, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, José trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y buen desempeño.
José se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una moto lineal de segunda mano, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder transportarse desde su vivienda hasta su centro de trabajo, ya que es una gran distancia y actualmente él se transporta en bicicleta, así pues José seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de de tener su propio negocio y así desea brindarle una buena educación a su pequeño.
texts.en:
José  is 40 years old, he lives in Chiclayo, in the district of Guadalupe. José has a small son who is 5 years old, who he loves very much and is his reason for living. He is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person who dedicates all his efforts to give his son a better life. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and because he needed to work from an early age, José was not able to study for a professional career as a Mechanic. In his free time, he likes to watch television and from time to time he cooks the delicious dish Tallarines that he shares with his family. On his own initiative, and through hard work and determination, José has found work as working in the fields on an agricultural farm in his city. He works every day for around 12 hours and he believes that things are going well due to his responsibility and work ethic. 
José is very thankful to the lenders of Kiva and thanks to their help, he will be able to purchase a second hand motorcycle that will help him commute between his house and his job; the distance is very long and he is currently using a bicycle. And so, José  can continue working to achieve his ultimate dream of having his own business and to be able to give his son an education.

loans.use: purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
This is Rosa, 31, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jack, her business partner, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rosa operates a repacking business. What she basically does is buy different products from wholesalers, repacks them, and sells them for a profit. Her regular customers are neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of peanuts, sweet beans, chestnuts, and other kinds of peanuts to expand her product inventory.

Rosa hopes to have more customers and dreams to give her children a good education and future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for peanuts, sweet beans, chestnuts and other kinds of peanuts to repack.

loans.name: Nery Orlando

texts.es: don nery de 46 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus hijos se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol es responsable y trabajador, solicita credito para la compra de insumos para poder seguir cultivando y poder incrementar sus ventas y llevar el sustento diario a su familia.
texts.en: Nery is 46 years old and lives with his wife and children.  He is engaged in growing corn and beans and he is responsible and hardworking.  He is requesting the loan to purchase supplies in order to be able to continue planting, increase sales, and in this way, provide his family with daily sustenance.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Tomasa Yamilet

texts.es: Tomasa Yamilet es una joven de treinta y tres años soltera madre de dos hijos de 6 y 15 años de edad, el mayor es estudiante de secundaria. Desde hace ocho años se dedica a la comercialización de granos básicos y catorce años en la venta de ropa nueva dentro de su casa al igual que de manera ambulante, por los momentos ella tiene colocada toda su mercadería en general ose la venta de ropa nueva y en espera de recibir sus abonos de este producto por lo que ella en este momento no tiene producto en su hogar,este  negocio que inició por iniciativa propia con ayuda de sus padres luego de quedar sola al frente del cuidado de sus hijos, ya que necesitaba encontrar una forma de subsistir  y tener ingresos económicos y darle a sus hijos lo necesario. Tomasa solicita el crédito por que planea seguir invirtiendo en granos básicos, ya que tiene que satisfacer la afluencia de clientes. Dentro de sus planes está seguir adelante con su negocio para darle un futuro profesional prometedor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Tomasa Yamilet is a young 33-year-old single mother of two children who are 6 and 15 years old.  The oldest is a high school student.  For eight years she has worked selling basic grains and new clothing inside her home and also as a street vendor.  For now she has generally placed all of her merchandise, that is to say, sold the new clothing and is waiting to receive her payments for this product so at this time she has no product in her home.  She started this business on her own initiative with the help of her parents after being left alone facing the care of her children, since she needed to find a way to subsist and to have an economic income and give to her children what they need.  

Tomasa is requesting the loan because she plans to continue investing in basic grains since she has to satisfy the influx of customers.  Within her plans is to continue moving forward with her business in order to give a promising professional future to her children.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains and invest in the purchase of assorted clothing for children, women, men and youths.

loans.name: Francisco Reymundo

texts.es: Don Francisco, continúa con su labor de vigilante para una empresa privada y su esposa le ayuda con los gastos también con la venta de tortillas las que vende todos los días, con arduo trabajo ha sacado adelante a sus cuatro hijos quienes estudian y su sueño y meta es verlos crecer como profesionales, es por eso todos sus esfuerzos centrados en ellos en brindarles lo mejor, el solicita un segundo crédito para puesta de verjas y puertas, dejando aun pendientes repello de paredes y piso los que poco a poco lograra con el pasar del tiempo.
texts.en:
Francisco continues to work as a guard with a private company. His wife helps him with the bills with her job selling tortillas. She sells them every day. Through hard work he has raised his four children who are all studying. His dream is to see them become professionals. For this reason, all his efforts are put into providing the best for them. 

He is requesting his second loan to put up grilles and doors. He still has to repair the walls and floor, which he will do over time bit by bit.

loans.use: to buy grilles and a door for his house

loans.name: Ariunbold

texts.en: Mr. Ariunbold is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2007 and has accumulated a vast amount of experience. Now he works as a driver at a private business entity where also his wife works and holds the position of general manager. Using his previous loan from our organization, he completed building his rental house. Now he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to install an electric heater and encase his house's roof with metals. Installing the electric heater will stop the usage of the furnace, in other words he will not burn coal as a fuel. Burning coal is considered to be main factor of air pollution in Ulaanbaatar according to survey. Also, fortifying the roof with metal will protect the house from strong storms and frosts, ensuring that the house will no longer lose its heat through the ceiling and roof. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who concerns greatly for his living environment and renters. If the area surrounding the house has poor air condition, it will not attract room-renters to his house.

loans.use: to install electric heater and fortify roof with metals

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
For Gulnora, this is the first loan from IMON and KIVA. She is a widow and has 5 children. A few years ago, her husband passed away and she, along with her 5 children, were left without a provider . She decided to start a new business in animal husbandry in order to generate an income.

She attended the course ‘To get ahead’ with a women's organization and learnt business skills. Her children will help her with the business. She will be a very successful businesswoman because she is hardworking and smart. Gulnora is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy cattle. She will use the loan and her business will have a good source of income, so her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing new business

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a 49 year old married woman and a mother of five children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She and her husband have been engaged in the fishing business for more than 10 years.
Amalia is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the fishing boat. With this, her husband will be able to catch more fish, allowing for a better  sale at the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the fishing boat

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is a 43 year old married woman and a mother of three children from Bien Unido, Bohol.  She earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and commodities to the local people.
Claudia is asking for a loan to buy more groceries like canned goods, candy, rice, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking ingredients and seasonings to sell in her store.  With this, she will be able to attract and serve more buyers in her store.
In the future, Claudia dreams of expanding her business and making it a huge success, so it will continue to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like canned goods, candy, rice, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking ingredients and seasonings to sell in her store

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is a fisherman from Bien Unido, Bohol.  He is a married man and a father of four children ages 12,10, 4 and 1.  Edgardo has been in the fishing business for more than 12 years.
As of this time, Edgardo is applying for a loan to buy new fishing nets, and a new boat engine.  In the future, Edgardo hopes of expanding his business and saving for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, and a new boat engine

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
This is Elvira, 39, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines.  She is married to Jaime, a driver and a father to their children.  She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Elvira maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands.  A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit.  Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and this profit is the dealer's  income.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php2000 in sales every week.

She is requesting a Php10, 000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Elvira hopes to have more products to sell and dreams of giving her children a good future and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week.   She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is married and works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store and selling fruit for the past six years.  Gina is applying for a loan of 60000 PHP, her tenth loan cycle from NWTF.  She successfully repaid her previous loans.  She will use the loan to buy grocery items for her store as well as the fruits to sell at her food stall.  Gina's store continues to provide her and her family with an income that improves their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Emilene

texts.en:
Emilene is a 48 year old married woman and a mother of three children from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in a rice farming business with her husband for more than 5 years. 
Emilene is asking for a loan to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.  With this, she will be able to improve their farm and its harvest.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 44 years old, married and has five children. She is raising hogs for income. She had been in this business for over five years and earns about P3,000 for each hog sold.  Celia hopes to improve nutrition of the hogs that is why she is asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy feed and vaccines for hogs sustenance.

In the future, Celia hopes to keep improving her business and keep saving funds for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for hogs sustenance

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May was born in 1970. She has two adult children. Her younger child goes to a high school and her older child is married. Her husband is an officer and has a salary of 2,000,000 VND per month. May sells sim cards and mobile phone numbers to earn a living. Her income is about 3,500,000 VND. She has done this job for 3 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 5,500,000 VND per month.

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2004. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 11,554,000 VND to buy more sim cards to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sim cards to sell.

loans.name: Bau

texts.en:
Bau was born in 1962. She has two children who are workers. Bau and her husband sell poultry eggs in a market. They have done this job for 4 years. Her income is about 3,500,000 VND. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,500,000 VND per month.

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2003. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 11,554,000 VND to buy more eggs to sell. She always wants to save more money to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en:
This is Prescilla, 54, a mother and resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Joseph, a seaman. Prescilla manages their household while operating a business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their family's everyday needs.

Prescilla maintains a direct-selling business. She sells different health products and apparel from Purple Networx. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with one month to pay. The dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and the difference provides the profits that dealers earn as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and residents of the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, Prescilla is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan to buy purple corn juice, optimum cleanse, optimum power, and different apparel as well as additional supplies and merchandise. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Prescilla hopes to expand her business and dreams that her youngest child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Mgii's Group

texts.en: Mgii is a sixty-three year old dryland farmer and mother of seven children. Her husband has passed away. The greatest challenge she faces in her agricultural endeavors is the low or absent rainfall. Mgii says, "I decided to join KOMAZA so that I can get money from the sale of trees to improve myself." She plans to use the profits from her tree farm to build rental houses at her nearby trading center.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: don Manuel vive en casa propia;el posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia solicita un crédito que le permita comprar mas granos basicos, Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios.
texts.en: Manuel lives in his own home.  He has a store, located in his house, from which he sells everyday items.  He is seeking a loan so that he can buy more basic grains.  He is seeking the loan since he has no other sources of income apart from his business.

loans.use: to invest more in his shop.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy was born in 1974. She has two children. Her daughters in the 3rd grade and the 9th grade. Her husband is a driver. His income is about 4,000,000 VND per month. Thuy has been working as a barber for three years. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. 

Thuy has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2005. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 11,118,000 VND to buy barber tools for her barber shop.

loans.use: to buy barber tools for her barber shop.

loans.name: Sareth's Group

texts.en: Sareth is 61 years old and a father of six children. He resides in Kandal province where rice and vegetable growing are the most popular businesses. Sareth is a peasant, and he has grown rice and vegetables for 36 years. Sareth has never taken a loan through with VisionFund before. He is applying for his first microfinance loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) as a member of a two-person borrower group. He wants to build a decent latrine for his family, which encouraged him to request this loan. He hopes that this construction will improve the hygiene of the family.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine

loans.name: Muzamiru

texts.en:
Muzamiru is 40 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, with three of them currently in school. For the past six years, Muzamiru has been working hard to manage his salon, which cuts men's hair. 

To help expand his business, Muzamiru has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more machines for the hair, and will help Muzamiru to generate greater profits, boost the business and increase their income. Muzamiru hopes that in the future he will be able to improve on the family well-being. 

Muzamiru is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Muzamiru who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more machines for the hair.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Despite her situation as a single parent, separated from her husband for three and one-half years, Arlene is able to sustain her children's needs. For over three years she has owned a restaurant located at a public market in Cordon that also serves as her retail store. Arlene's goal is to have a profitable business so she can educate her four children.

Arlene is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy meat, vegetables, ingredients and cases of soft drinks for her eatery. She hopes for approval of her loan so she can keep her restaurant progressive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, ingredients and cases of soft drinks for her eatery.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a divorced mother with four children all of whom attend school. Mwaka considers herself a hard-worker who is responsible and really wants to better herself. 

Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit, she set up a business making food, which she has been running from home for four years. Everyday Mwaka gets up at 5 a.m. to prepare food for selling. She enjoys her job a lot.

The aim of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business by buying staple goods for food production, including purchasing maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and tea leaves.

Mwaka is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders offer to people with scarce resources, so that they can have a way of working with dignity.

loans.use: purchase staple goods for food production, including maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and tea leaves.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia de 29 años es una mujer de mucha actividad laboral , esta casada con Alberto  y juntos tienen una niña de 8 años.
Posee junto a su pareja una vivienda construida  a base de material noble producto de muchos años de trabajo.
Posee una parcela en la cual produce cacao orgánico, al ser una persona muy activa logro con el tiempo expandirla y dedicarse con el paso de los años a la administración directa de la producción.
Lleva 3 años a cargo de sus parcelas y siempre tuvo en mente buscar dedicarse solo a la administración de las mismas brindándo asi una  oportunidad laboral a muchos jóvenes en su localidad.
Para el normal desempeño de sus actividades requiere contar con capital para la compra de abonos el cual es necesario para que sus plantaciones obtengan una producción de calidad al finalizar la temporada previa  a la cosecha.Sus objetivos económicos a largo plazo esperan lograr la compra de mas parcelas para dedicarlos a la producción de café orgánico y achiote el cual espera cumplirlo muy pronto y seguir mejorando la calidad de vida para su familia.En esta ocasión requiere contar con 1,500 soles para la compra de sacos de abono orgánico y así mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Delia is 29 year old busy working woman.  She is married to Alberto and they have an 8 year old daughter.  They have a house, built of fine material, a product of many years of hard work.  They have a plot of land on which they produce organic cacao.  Being a very busy person, she expanded it and over time, she became engaged in the direct administration of production.  She has taken care of her plots for three years and always had it in mind to dedicate herself solely to administration and in this way, offer job opportunities to the young people in the area.

In order to carry out normal business activities, she needs capital to purchase fertilizers, which are necessary so that her plantings obtain a quality production at the end of the pre-season harvest.  Her long-term financial goal is to purchase more plots for the production of organic coffee and achiote (a spice made from the red seed of the annatto tree).  She hopes to achieve this goal and continue improving the quality of life for her family.  At this time, she is requesting 1,500 soles to purchase sacks of organic fertilizer and in this way, improve her production.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: don oscar de 60 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus hijos, vive en casa propia, tiene 15 años de trabajar como agricultor y tiene cultivos de maiz y maicillo, esta solicitando un credito para mejorar su vivienda, ya que tiene construida solo una parte de ella y quiere terminarla de construir para que el y su familia puedan vivir mas comodos y tranquilos.
texts.en: Don Oscar, 60 years old, lives with his wife and children.  He lives in his own home.  He has worked for 15 years as a farmer and has crops of corn and sorghum.  He is requesting a loan to improve his home since he has only a part of it constructed and wants to finish the construction so that he and his family can live more comfortably and peacefully.

loans.use: to improve his home.

loans.name: Badamsuren

texts.en: Mrs. Badamsuren is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Amgalan area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband Purevsuren, age 42, works at the state-owned company as driver. Her son Purevdagva, age 20, is a university student and her daughter Purevmaa, age 15, goes to a local school. The borrower has been running her organic dairy products sales business in the local market since September 2012. She has worked as a saleswoman before and has experience in the business. She is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase a large quantity of organic dairy products to sell to local customers. She is a hardworking, self-asserting and honest woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of organic dairy products to sell to local customers

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a 45-year-old married woman who lives in Solana with her spouse and children. She is raising hogs to sell for profits. She has been in this business for more than five years and earns about P5,000 for each hog disposed. She uses the profits to pay for meals and allowance for her children, who are in college earning a degree. 

Florencia is now asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy feed for maintaining hogs. It will help nourish the hogs so she can sell them for a higher price. 

With good income she will save for her family's future expenses, leading to income stability someday.

loans.use: to buy feed for maintaining hogs

loans.name: Nobert

texts.en: Nobert is a 29-year-old ambitious man living in Kasese, Uganda. For five years now he has been a banker, and with the proceeds, he has been able to buy a motorcycle for a transport business. He is a very determined man and wants to become a central bank governor in the future, and that is why he wants to upgrade his studies. Nobert intends to use the loan to pay school fees for himself.

loans.use: to pay school fees for himself.

loans.name: Thereza

texts.en:
Thereza used the previous loan to pay school fees for her children. She is a 48-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. After assessing the lucrative nature of the transport sector, she decided to invest in motorcycle transport, and with the income earned, she has been able to buy land and pay school fees for her children. 

Thereza's courage is such as you can rarely find, given the cultural set-up that women are not supposed to ride motorcycles, but she does. She has been in business for three years. Her major challenges are high fuel costs and the poor road network, while her business dream is to hire out the motorcycle and venture into farming if she gets enough capital. Thereza is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal el El Progreso está conformado por 9 integrantes, 7 mujeres y dos hombres, madres y padres de familia, con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. El sauce se carateriza por  la producción de productos lácteos, crema, leche, cuajada, queso. Los integrantes del esta banco son personas responsables, trabajadoras, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente ninguna pudo estudiar por falta de recursos económicos; por que luchan día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
La coordinadora del banco comunal el progreso es María Emperatriz, y tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosa de horno, comida típica de la región, actividad que la desempeña de forma ambulante, con una pana sobre su cabeza de unos 20 kg ofreciendo su  productos a clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de materia prima para elaborar las cosas de horno como maíz, leña, leche, cuajada, azúcar, bolsas plásticas. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal El progreso agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The El Progreso communal bank has 9 members, 7 women and two men, mothers and fathers with families and a total of 20 children in their care.  They are from El Sauce, a place that is located in the northern area of the country. El Sauce is known for the production of dairy products, cream, milk, curds and cheese. The members of this bank are responsible, hard-working people with the desire to get ahead. Unfortunately none of them were able to study; so they strive day after day to give their children a better future.

The coordinator of the El Progreso communal bank is María Emperatriz, and her business is the sale of baked goods, a typical food of the region. She runs her business in an itinerant fashion, with a 20 kg basket on her head, offering her products to established and potential clients. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital, in the purchase of raw material for making baked goods like corn, firewood, milk, curds, sugar and plastic bags, so that she will have better earnings in the not-so-distant future. The El Progreso communal bank thanks the Kiva investors for their help providing people with scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua to have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to buy raw material for making baked goods like corn, firewood, milk, curds, sugar and plastic bags.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: Doña Maria de 52 años de edad vive con un familiar en casa propia, trabaja como vendedora de papas fritas cerca de su lugar de residencia, el negocio le ha generado una excelente rentabilidad, desea solicitar un credito con el fin de aumentar mas el inventario del negocio y mejorar los sartenes donde prepara las papas, y asi poder seguir llevando el sustento diario a su casa.
texts.en: Doña Maria, 52 years old, lives with a relative in her own home.  She works as a French fry seller near her place of residence.  The business has generated an excellent profitability for her.  She wants to apply for a loan with the goal of further increasing the inventory of her business and improving the frying pans where she prepares the potatoes and thus be able to continue bringing daily sustenance to her home.

loans.use: to improve her cooking utensils for her sales of French fries.

loans.name: Sonia Elsy

texts.es:
Sonia, se dedica a la venta de comida, tiene 45 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, su esposo esta fuera del país pero le ayuda económicamente, tiene 10 años de estar dedicada a este negocio, trabaja de lunes a viernes.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de una cocina y artículos que sean necesarios para elaborar los distintos menús, esta inversión le ayudara a Sonia, para poder mejorar en el negocio y realizar sus ventas diarias.
La aspiración de Sonia es que su negocio sea rentable, fortalecerlo, ayudar a su familia brindándole una buena condición de vida.
texts.en:
Sonia makes a living from selling food, is 45 years old and has two children. Her husband is out of the country but he helps her financially. She has had her business for 10 years and works from Monday to Friday. 

She is asking for a loan to buy a stove and other items necessary to make different menus. This investment will help Sonia to improve her business and achieve her daily sales.

Sonia's aspiration is that her business be profitable, to strengthen it and to help her family, providing them with a better quality of life.
