loans.use: to buy more groceries, such as bread, canned goods, soft drinks, noodles and school supplies, to sell in her store.

loans.name: Marelin Elizabeth

texts.es: Marelin de 25 años vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas quienes son menores de edad y estudian viven en casa propia responsable, honesta y trabajadora es comerciante de joyeria en enchape con lo que vende logra cubrir los gatos de su hogar, solicita un credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y poder tener mas ganacias y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida con la ayuda de su esposo.
texts.en: 25 year old Marelin lives with her husband and two daughters who are young and in school. They live in their own house. She is responsible, honest, and hardworking. She sells plated jewelry and, with the profits, she is able to cover the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise and to be able to have more income and, with her husband's help, give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: have working capital

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Married to Eva, a saleslady and a mother to their children, Noel is a 48-year-old resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines He and his wife manage their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Noel operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. Noel earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 18,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his enterprise.

Noel dreams that his business will grow and have other branches, and he hopes for the family to have their own house. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.es: La Sra. Tereza tiene 39 años es casada con dos hijos de las edades de 4 y 2 años, ella tiene un puesto  donde vende desayunos por las mañanas muy tempranos tiene para la venta de té y café, en la zona de Chuquiaguillo de la ciudad de La Paz, La Sra. Tereza es una persona muy trabajadora  que con dedicación poco a poco va adquiriendo estabilidad y solvencia y también popularidad por que es muy conocida por sus clientes ya que La Sra. Tereza les atiende muy amablemente,  con el dinero del crédito comprara material de construcción para la refacción de su puesto de venta ya que el mal tiempo lo malogro y desea hacer arreglar y ampliar, La Sra. Tereza cliente cuenta que con mucho esfuerzo piensa que se puede crecer más y así seguir haciéndose de patrimonio para el bienestar de su familia y también personal.
texts.en: Tereza is 39 years old, married, and has 2 children who are 4 and 2 years old. She has a stall where she sells breakfast in the very early mornings. She sells tea and coffee. She works in the Chuquiaguillo area of the city of La Paz. Tereza is a hardworking person who, little by little and with much dedication, has acquired stability, solvency, and also popularity for it is well known among her customers that Tereza treats them very kindly. She will use the money from the loan to buy construction material to refurbish her stall as bad weather has degraded it and she wants to repair and extend it. Teresa says that she thinks she can grow more if she works hard and can give herself and her family wellbeing.

loans.use: to refurbish her stall as bad weather has degraded it.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es: Doña Evangelina, tiene tres hijos labora como responsable de comidas rápidas en una estación de servicios, sus créditos los ha utilizado en mejoras de vivienda y en esta ocasión desea comprar malla para brindarle mayor seguridad del porche, también desea ponerle cerámica, para darle mejor imagen a su hogar gracias al apoyo de sus hijos ella paga sus prestamos, ya que sus ingresos no le es suficiente.
texts.en: Evangelina has three children. She works as a fast food manager in a service station. She has used her loans to make improvements to her home and, on this occasion, she wants to buy wire mesh to make her porch more secure. She also wants to put in tiles to make her home look better. She repays her loans with help from her sons as her income isn't enough.

loans.use: to buy mesh, tile, and cement.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru:
Илхомчон молодой мужчина в возрасте 37 лет, он женат и имеет детей. Его жена домохозяйка, дети еще очень маленькие и она занимается  воспитанием  детей. Илхом является плотником.  Производит мебель. Он занимается этим ремеслом в течении 15 лет. У него много клиентов и хорошая репутация среди близких и родственников. Он очень гордиться, и любит свою работу. Также дополнительно в свободное время  Илхом занимается откормом мелко рогатого скота. Но основной доход от производство мебели.
   Илхом мечтает купить машину, так как ему трудно и дорого каждый раз заказывать машину для перевозок бревен и новых инструментов. С этой целю  он обратился в Арванд за кредитом так как ему не хватает денежных средств для покупки авто.   Он очень надеется на помощь от организации Арванд потому что, купив машину ему будет удобно развозить заказы и покупать сырье для своей работы.
texts.en: Ilhomjon is a young man 37 years of age.  He's married and has children.  His wife is a homemaker and is need to raise the children since they are still little.  Ilhomjon is a carpenter who has made furniture for a profession for the last 15 years.  He has many clients and has a good reputation among friends and relatives.  He loves his work and takes pride in it.  In his free time, Ilhomjon works with livestock, fattening animals to sell.  It's the furniture-making, however, that is his main source of income.  He dreams of buying a car since it is difficult and expensive to rent vehicles to carry logs and new tools.  With this goal in mind, he has turned to Arvand for a loan since he doesn't not have enough funds to buy the car outright.  He relies on the support of Arvand since purchasing the car will make it much more convenient to deliver orders and to buy raw materials for his work.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Ivan

texts.ru:
Иван  - фермер. С 2010 года занимается выращиванием бахчевых культур арбуза и дыни.
Справляться по хозяйству ему помогает супруга и двое детей 32-х и 26-ти лет.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания бахчевых культур.
 Иван решил приобрести  пленку для перекрытия теплицы, капельную ленту для полива.
В планах на будущее:  расширить посевную площадь, построить холодильное хранилище для хранения и охлаждения готовой продукции.
В личных планах: Достроить жилой дом.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования пленки и капельной ленты.
texts.en: Ivan is a farmer.  Since 2010, he has grown watermelons and cantaloupe.  His wife and his two children (aged 32 and 26) help him with his work.  The growth of his business began by planting melons.  Ivan has decided to purchase plastic sheeting to cover his greenhouses, and drip hosing for irrigation.  In the future, he plans to expand the amount of land his farms, and to build cold storage to store his crops.  His personal plans include building his own home.  He needs your help to finance the purchase of plastic sheeting and drip hosing.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Alla

texts.ru:
Алла  -  женщина фермер.  С 2011 года занимается выращиванием бахчевых культур таких как дыня и арбуз.
Справляться по хозяйству ей помогает муж.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания бахчевых культур в открытом грунте.
Алла решила приобрести пленку для перекрытия теплицы и капельную ленту для полива.
В планах на будущее:  расширить посевные площади бахчевых культур, купить трактор и навесное оборудование к нему для вспашки и обработки своего земельного участка.
В личных планах: обеспечить образование детей.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования пленки и капельной ленты.
texts.en: Alla is a farmer.  Since 2011, she has raised crops such as watermelon and cantaloupe.  Her husband helps her with her work.  The growth of her business began by planting melons in an open field.  Alla has decided to purchase plastic sheeting to enclose her greenhouses as well as drip hosing for irrigation.  In the future, she plans to expand the area of land she farms and to buy a tractor with a till to work her land.  Her personal plans include saving for her children's education.  She needs your help to finance the purchase of plastic sheeting and drip hosing.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда  -  женщина фермер.  С 2006 года занимается выращиванием бахчевых культур таких как дыня и арбуз.
Справляться по хозяйству ей помогает муж.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания бахчевых культур в открытом грунте.
Надежда решила приобрести пленку для перекрытия теплицы и капельную ленту для полива.
В планах на будущее:  расширить посевные площади бахчевых культур, посадить новые сорта дыни и арбуза.
В личных планах: обеспечить образование детей.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования пленки и капельной ленты.
texts.en: Nadezhda has been a farmer since 2006, raising melons like cantaloupe and watermelon.  Her husband helps her with her work.  Her business began growing by planting melons in an open field.  Nadezhda has decided to purchase plastic to enclose her greenhouses as well as drip hosing for irrigation.  In the future, she plans on expand the area of land she farms to plant new types of cantaloupe and watermelon.  Her personal plans include saving for her children's education.  She needs your help financing the purchase of plastic sheeting and drip hosing.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталья  -  женщина фермер.  С 2006 года занимается выращиванием бахчевых культур, таких как дыня и арбуз.
Справляться по хозяйству ей помогает муж и двое детей 11-ти и 7-ми лет.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания бахчевых культур в открытом грунте.
Наталья решила приобрести пленку для перекрытия теплицы и капельную ленту для полива.
В планах на будущее:  расширить посевные площади бахчевых культур.
В личных планах: обеспечить образование детей.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования пленки и капельной ленты.
texts.en: Natalilya has been a farmer since 2006, growing melons like cantaloupe and watermelon.  Her husband and two children (aged 11 and 7) help her with her work.  The growth of her business began by planting melons in an open field.  Nataliya has decided to purchase plastic to enclose greenhouses as well as drip hosing for irrigation.  In the future, she plans on expanding the area of land she farms.  Her personal plans include saving for her children's education.  She needs your help financing the purchase of plastic sheeting and drip hosing.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Оксана  -  женщина фермер.  С 2001 года занимается выращиванием бахчевых культур таких как дыня и арбуз.
Справляться по хозяйству ей помогает муж и двое детей 11-ти и 7-ми лет.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания молодых огурцов в открытом грунте.
Оксана решила приобрести пленку для перекрытия теплицы.
В планах на будущее:  расширить посевные площади бахчевых культур,  поставить новую теплицу.
В личных планах: обеспечить образование детей.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования пленки для теплицы.
texts.en: Oksana has been a farmer since 2001, growing melons like cantaloupe and watermelon.  Her husband and two children (aged 11 and 7) help her with her work.  The growth of her business began by planting cucumbers in an open field.  Oksana has decided to buy plastic to enclose greenhouses.  In the future, she plans on expanding the area of land she farms and to build a new greenhouse.  Her personal plans include saving for her children's education.  She needs your help financing the purchase of plastic sheeting for her greenhouses.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Daniela Estefania

texts.es:
La Sra. Daniela vive en Guayaquil, tiene 31 años. Empezó su negocio hace aproximadamente 10 años, con la liquidación de su trabajo decidió establecer su propio negocio, poco a poco creció hasta llegar a tener su negocio de venta de artículos varios bien surtido.

Comienza su labor desde las 6:00 de la mañana sale a dejar a sus hijos a la escuela luego comienza con la apertura de su negocio a las 8:00 de la mañana, su dificultad es la delincuencia pero la policía está realizando operativos por su casa con más frecuencia.

Ella está casada en unión libre su esposo trabaja de maestro albañil, tienen 2 hijos que estudian en escuela fiscal.

Ella anhela con el préstamo poder comprar ropa, cd, zapatillas y asi tener ingresos para poder comprar material de construcción; cemento, hierro y arena para seguir avanzando en mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Daniela, age 31, lives in Guayaquil.  She started her business approximately ten years ago.  She decided to use her severance pay to establish her own business.  It grew little by little until she came to have a well-stocked business selling various items.

She starts her work at six in the morning when she leaves to take her children to school.  Then she starts with the opening of her business at eight in the morning.  Her difficulty is crime.  However, the police are now making more frequent efforts by her house.

She is in a common-law marriage, and her husband works as a master bricklayer.  They have two children who attend public school.

She is eager to use the loan to be able to buy clothes, CDs, and sandals.  This way she will have income in order to be able to buy construction materials, cement, iron, and sand.  She will do this in order to continue making advancements in improving her house.

loans.use: to buy clothes, CDs, and sandals.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie, aged 33, is borrowing PHP 10,000 as additional working capital in her piggery business. It will be use to purchase feeds, vitamins and medicine. This will be a great assistance in providing a better quality of life for her pigs. She has had nine years in this business and feels that she has a healthier living because of it. She is aspiring for more: a better way of living, a good education for her children and a good future. Hopefully, with her unending hard work and strong determination, she can achieve the goals to which she aspires.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamin and medicine

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie is 52 years old, married and has eight grown up children. One is living with them at Alimanao. To make a living, Tessie cooks and sells food for snacks and daily meals. She also manages a small store selling grocery items. She wants to generate good profits, that is why she keeps on diversifying her business. She is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy meat, vegetables, and ingredients to cook and sell in her food stall. With the help of this loan, Tessie will be providing better products and services to all her customers, leading to an income progression needed by the family.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, and ingredients to cook and sell in her food stall

loans.name: Vadim

texts.ru:
Вадим - фермер. С 2000 года занимается выращиванием бахчевых культур арбуза и дыни.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания баклажан.
Вадим решил приобрести  пленку для перекрытия теплицы, капельную ленту для полива.
В планах на будущее:  приобрести трактор и навесное оборудование к нему для обработки и вспашки своего земельного участка, расширить посевную площадь бахчевых, приобрести холодильное оборудование для хранения и охлаждения готовой продукции.
В личных планах: Достроить жилой дом.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования пленки и капельной ленты.
texts.en: Vadim has been a farmer since the year 2000, growing melons like cantaloupe and watermelon.  The growth of his business began by growing eggplant.  Vadim has decided to purchase plastic to enclose greenhouses, as well as drip hosing for irrigation.  In the future, he plans on purchasing a tractor with a till attachment that will help him work his land.  He also plans on expanding the area of land he farms and to build cold storage to store his harvested crops.  His personal plans include building a home.  He needs your help to finance the purchase of plastic sheeting and rip hosing.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
This is Priscila, 41 years old, and a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Mario, a driver, and is a mother to their children. She, with the help of her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
Priscila operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to cook food for one or two people when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Priscila hopes to expand her business and dreams to live a long life to guide her children. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and products needed to prepare her food.

loans.name: Chanbothrey's Group

texts.en: Chanbothrey is 31 years old and a rural resident from Kandal province. She is blessed with a son who currently is studying in the local area. For the family’s sake, she tailors clothes and works as a paid traditional performer during wedding ceremonies whereas her husband drives as a paid-tricycle motorbike. The current business earns her about USD 12 per day. Chabonthrey, a four time borrower, forms a group of two seeking a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has succeeded in utilizing her loans to upgrade her lifestyle in a good manner. Now, she and her co-borrower are seeking 160,000 KHR each. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy below-the-ground items to build a proper latrine for her family. She hopes to improve the hygienic practice of the family.

loans.use: to buy below-the-ground items to build a proper latrine.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en: Lucrecia is 57 years old, married, and has eight children. She works very hard to provide for them. She is selling fried chicken in the market. She is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase chicken, cooking oil and ketchup. She is hoping that the loan will improve her income for her children.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, cooking oil and ketchup for her fried chicken stand.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina continua en el banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, ella tiene 46 años de edad y tiene tres hijos de las cuales todos son independientes. 

Marcelina es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora que saca adelante a su familia pues se sigue dedicándose  a la panadería y elabora panes “Chuta” que son panes tradicionales de la ciudad de Oropesa y Cusco. 

En esta oportunidad Marcelina requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de harina, sacos de azúcar y levadura.
texts.en:
Marcelina is still in the Asociación Arariwa's “Ricchariy Puririsun” communal bank. She lives in the city of Oropesa in the province of Cusco. She is 46 years old and has three children, all of whom are independent. Marcelina is an entrepreneurial and striving woman who is getting her family ahead. She is still making a living from the bakery and making “Chuta” breads, traditional breads from the city of Oropesa and Cusco.

On this occasion, Marcelina requires the loan to buy supplies like for example sacks of flour, sacks of sugar and yeast.

loans.use: to buy supplies like for example sacks of flour, sacks of sugar and yeast

loans.name: Lourinda

texts.en:
Lourinda is 54 years old, married and has five children. Her husband is a tricycle driver while she buys and sells junk and other recyclable items for profit. She also manages a store. Her income of P 10,000 monthly goes for meals, allowance for her children and revolving capital in the business. Three of her children are at school and she wants to give them the best education. Now, she is asking for a loan of P 20,000 to buy more empty cans, bottles and jars to re-sell for profit. Another part of her loan will be used in buying additional grocery items for the store.
Someday, Lourinda hopes to achieve good profits and keep developing her business. This will help save for the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy more empty cans, bottles and jars to re-sell for profit.

loans.name: Raisa

texts.ru:
Раиса   -  женщина фермер.  С 1980 года занимается выращиванием бахчевых культур, таких как дыня и арбуз.
Справляться по хозяйству ей помогает муж и двое детей 33-х и 38-ми лет.
Раиса решила приобрести пленку для перекрытия теплицы и капельную ленту для полива.
В планах на будущее:  расширить посевные площади бахчевых культур, купить трактор для вспашки земельного участка.
В личных планах: достроить дом.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования пленки и капельной ленты.
texts.en: Raisa has been a farmer since 1980, growing melons like cantaloupe and watermelon.  Her husband two children (aged 33 and 38) help her with her work.  Raisa has decided to purchase plastic to enclose greenhouses as well as drip hosing for irrigation.  In the future, she plans to expand the area of land where she grows her melons and to buy a tractor with a till attachment that will help her work her land.  Her personal plans include building a home.  She needs your help to finance the purchase of plastic sheeting and drip hosing.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina is 55 years old, and is married with four children. To generate income, she is engaged in a retail business. She has been running her sari-sari store for almost seven years. She usually receives a net income of PHP 350 a day, and it’s just enough to cover their daily needs. Right now, she is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 8,000 to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, condiments, assorted breads and beverages to sell. Avelina hopes that she can obtain her desired loan to improve her business as well as her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, condiments, assorted breads and beverages to sell

loans.name: Simona

texts.en: Simona is married with six children. She manages a piggery business and at the same time sells vegetables at their market every market day. She is working so hard to provide for her children’s necessities. She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs and vegetables to resell.  She hopes to have more income to provide for the needs of her family. Someday, their living will be improved by her loan and hard work.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru: Оксана работает научным сотрудником в институте. Она живет в трехкомнатной квартие вместе со своей мамой. Окна и двери старые, пропускают тепло и шум. Оксана хочет заменить окна и двери на новые и таки образом экономить энергию и деньги на отопление.
texts.en: Oksana is a research fellow at a university.  She lives in a third-story apartment together with her mother.  The doors and windows in the apartment are old and let in the cold and noise.  She wants to replace these doors and windows with new ones in order to save on the money she spends on energy and heating.

loans.use: to replace doors and windows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand, iron and ceramics.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en: Felina has operated a variety store for over a year. She is 31 years of age, happily married and blessed with three children. Her main priority at this time is to increase her sales and profit so she can improve their living. She would like to take out a loan of PHP 8,000 allowing her to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, and assorted biscuits. She hopes to get approval of her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles and assorted biscuits.

loans.name: Melda

texts.en: Hog-raising is the primary source of income for Melda. She has been in this business for three years. Melda is 33 years old and still single. She devotes herself to her business. At this time, Melda wants to have more hogs to raise, but she lacks the necessary capital. In this regard, she is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy additional hogs to raise and the feed for them. She hopes to grow her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs to raise and the feed for them.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine, aged 48, is the loving mother of six children. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vitamins of her current hogs. She hopes that her business will be successful so that she can save and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Samang's Group

texts.en:
Samang, a resident of Sa Ang district, Kandal Province, is married and a father of six children. He has one-half hectare of rice growing and supplements the family’s income with a fish-catching business. After several years’ engagement in the current business, he is able to earn up to 9,000 KHR per day.

This is his first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He forms a group of three, to apply for a latrine loan. Samang, the group leader, will use his part of the loan to buy below-ground items, including the latrine slab and pans, as well as pits, to build a decent latrine for his family. He hopes this new latrine will promote good health practices for his family.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine for his family

loans.name: Crane Group

texts.en:
Yusuph, who is in his mid-30’s, is married and has two boys of whom one goes to school and the remaining is still too young. He has a motorcycle transportation business commonly known as bodaboda in East Africa. He has had this venture for a period of two years now. Daily he works from 06am to 08pm and is able to make a fair monthly profit.
This will be his 4th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans he paid them back successfully and he bought fuel and serviced his motorcycle. With the profits earned he bought a plot of land where he dreams to build a nice family house. He will use this loan to add to his saved amount to buy a new motorcycle. He dreams to own more motorcycles and a nice house.
He will share this loan with his loan group "CRANE " which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to add to his saved amount to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Norly

texts.en: Norly is 24 years old and single, but has two children. He has been running a cellphone and repair shop for three years. He earns about PHP 10,000 monthly. He utilizes his gained income to provide for his children, for his daily necessities, and to support his business. Norly aims to have more capital in order for him to maintain the good flow of his sales and profits. With regards to his goal, he decided to borrow additional capital in the amount of PHP 15,000. He will use this amount to buy cellphones and accessories for his shop. He hopes to get this loan in order for him to get ahead in life and save for the brighter future of his two children.

loans.use: to buy cellphones and accessories for his shop

loans.name: Celsa Maria

texts.es:
Doña Celsa de 46 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene 2 hijos y vive con ellos en una colonia de la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
Doña Celsa hace 10 años emprendió un negocio de pulperia con ventas de abarrotes, granos básicos,golosinas etc.este negocio lo inicio con la visión de le iría muy bien porque son productos de primera necesidad para el hogar.Manifiesta que con las ganancias obtenidas podrá ampliar mas el negocio.Esta muy agradecida con Odef por los financiamientos otorgados los cuales le han ayudado mucho a mantenerlo estable, dándoles a sus clientes el servicio de los productos necesarios.
Actualmente este es su préstamo numero ocho  de 20,000 lempiras el cual invertirá en la compra de granos básicos, como harina, maseca, frijoles, azúcar, arroz, abarrotes , lácteos etc. 
La meta de Doña Celsa es seguir trabajando siempre con los financiamientos que le brinda Odef y llegar a tener un mejor solvencia económica para ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Doña Celsa, age 46, is single because she is a widow. She has two children who live with her in a neighborhood in the city of San Pedro Sula.

Ten years ago, Doña Celsa established her grocery business where she sells products such as basic grains, snack foods, and other items. She started this business with the intent of doing very well since these products are basic necessities in the home. Celsa says that the profits that she has earned have enabled her to expand her business. She is very grateful to ODEF for the loans that have been provided since they have been a great help in keeping her business stables. As a result, she has been able to offer her customers with the products they need.

Celsa is currently requesting her eighth loan in the amount of 20,000 HNL. The money will be invested in the purchase of basic grains, flour, cornmeal, beans, sugar, rice, groceries, dairy products, and other items. Her goal is to continue working with the loans provided by ODEF in order to have improved financial solvency so that she can help her children.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, flour, cornmeal, beans, sugar, rice, groceries, dairy products, and other items.

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en: Warlito is 32 years old and still single. He aims to become financially stable in order to help in financing the education of his younger brothers and to improve their status of living. Due to lack of job opportunities, he cultivates their farmland by planting rice and vegetables. He aimed to plant more vegetables to sell but he has inadequate capital. For this reason, he is asking for an additional PHP 10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, power cleaner and a sprayer needed in vegetable production. He hopes that this loan will help him to improve his farming business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, power cleaner and a sprayer needed in vegetable production

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 41 years old, married and has two children. To acquire income, he manages a welding shop in their village. He has been in this business for five years, gaining an income of about PHP 30,000 each month. He uses the income to educate his children and as revolving capital in the business too. He is now applying for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy welding rods used in his business. He hopes to keep improving his services and acquire more customers in order to gain a profitable income. Additional revenue will be used for education and emergency purposes. His photo was taken at his shop with his wife beside him.

loans.use: to buy welding rods used in his business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites offers frozen foods, dried fish and milk fish.She has been running this food sales business for two years. Marites's husband is a bus driver. The couple works hard, in order to have a better way of living and educate their two children.

Marites is seeking additional capital of PHP 10,000. She will use it to buy stock of frozen foods, milk fish and dried fish, for her food sales. She believes that by using this additional capital she's requesting, she will be able to increase her income and be able to give her children a quality education and comfortable lifestyle. In addition. she could also satisfy and supply all her customer demand. Marites hopes for approval of her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to buy stock of frozen foods, milk fish and dried fish, for her food sales business

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is 60 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell like shampoo, soap, cooking oil and other miscellaneous items. Merlinda has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from a computer gaming station. Merlinda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Melchorita

texts.en: Melchorita is 63 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store. Melchorita has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming vegetables and raising chickens. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Noime

texts.en:
This is Noime. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more varieties and larger quantities of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a junk shop for additional income.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time in the amount of 50,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products, to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit.  Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Noime dreams that her businesses will grow bigger and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories about her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who meet to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages, to resell in her store

loans.name: Wilson's Group

texts.en:
Wilson is married and has two children. He is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is a farmer and grows assorted crops, such as watermelon, squash and peppers, to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years.

Wilson has requested a loan to purchase construction materials needed for his house completion. He has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. He is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials needed for completion of his house

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
Simona, es casada y tiene tres hijos , vive en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona villa Esperanza de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel de primaria y actualmente se dedica al comercio de condimentos, principalmente ají, los cuales lleva al interior del país.
El crédito lo requiere para aumento de capital y así comprar más ají y mejorar el comercio de condimentos.
El sueño de Simona es ser comerciante mayorista de condimentos.
Es la sexta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la tercera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Simona is married and has three children. She lives in her own home, which is located in the District of Villa Esperanza in the city of El Alto.

Simona has an elementary school education. She currently sells condiments, mainly aji peppers, which she brings in from the interior parts of the country. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her capital so that she can buy more aji peppers and improve her condiment business.

Simona’s dream is to become a wholesale condiment trader. This is the sixth time she has requested a loan from IMPRO, but the third time through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more aji peppers in bulk.

loans.name: Him's Group

texts.en:
Him, 38, is a rural farmer from Kandal Province’s Sa Ang district. She is the only breadwinner in the family, which includes her three children, who are still in school. To cover the daily cost of living, she grows rice on one hectare of farmland and grows mushrooms, for additional income. The current business returns her about 9,200 KHR per day.

This is the first loan for Him with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Him's Group is a first-microloan group comprised of four members. Him, the group leader, will use her portion of the loan to build a decent latrine for her family. She has high hopes that her family will own a proper latrine, which will help her family to maintain good health practices.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family

loans.name: Nevesia's Group

texts.en:
Nevesia is 47 years old and lives in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga. She is married and has one child. She has a shop, where she sells assorted grocery items. She has had this business for six years.

Nevesia requested a loan to purchase 20 boxes of grocery items to resell. She has been a member of PMPC for five years. She is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To purchase 20 boxes of assorted groceries, to resell in her store

loans.name: Acielita

texts.en:
Acielita is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than 25 years now. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Acielita is asking for a loan to buy paint and plywood for the repair of the boat. With this, they will be able to improve their fishing business and also their income.

In the future, Acielita has hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy paint and plywood for the repair of the boat

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en: Ma. Lourdes is 61 years old. She is a widow with three children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Ma. Lourdes is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Ma. Lourdes has been farming sugarcane for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria, se ha decidido por seguir creciendo en el negocio,  comprando materiales que utiliza  por eso solicita un préstamo para la compra de barro, nacazcol, pago de transporte para salir vender.
Con el préstamo anterior manifiesta que fue de mucha ayuda, para la producción, por eso se motivo a seguir con préstamos, ella ha comprado materiales para la producción de loza, que hasta el momento esto le ayudado a generar más ventas, en su familia ha nacido una niña de tres meses.
texts.en:
Gloria, has decided to continue growing her business, buying materials she uses, that is why she is requesting a loan to purchase clay and black dye, and for transportation payment, to go out and sell.

She states that with the previous loan it was very helpful for the production, for that reason it motivates her to continue with loans. She has bought materials for the stoneware production which until now has helped her generate more sales. A baby girl, now three months old, has been born in her family.

loans.use: to purchase clay and black dye and for transportation payment.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a 47-year-old, married woman, and a mother of four children, from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business, together with her husband, for more than two years.

Anecita is asking for a loan to buy a new boat engine. With the new engine, she and her husband will be able to improve their fishing catch and augment their income.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine

loans.name: Estrella's Group

texts.en:
Estrella is married and has one child. She is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years.

She has requested a loan to purchase feed and other things she needs to maintain her pigs. Estrella has been a member of PMPC for almost five years. She is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they are borrowing as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To purchase five sacks of feed and things she needs, for maintaining her pigs

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 45 years old and lives in Calaran, Calamba. She is married with three children. 

Marietta has a shop that sells grocery items and assorted beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan to purchase new stock of groceries and beverages.

Marietta has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Marietta hopes to educate her children through her income from her business financed by Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: To purchase 20 boxes of assorted groceries and beverages.

loans.name: Blanca Sonia

texts.es:
Blanca, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive solo con sus dos hijos de 15 y 18 años, el negocio ya tiene más de 10 años de existir, lo realiza todos los días, con lo que ha mantenido a su familia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales necesarios para elaborar las tortillas, como el maíz por mayoreo, leña, bolsas plásticas, esto le ayudara al fortalecimiento del negocio, tener más satisfechos a los clientes. 
Su sueño es ayudar a sus hijos a estudiar, con el aporte del negocio, pues esto les permitirá mejorar su condición de vida a futuro.
texts.en:
Blanca sells tortillas. She lives with her two children aged 15 and 18. She has had the business for more than 10 years, which she does every day, and which has supported her family.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of materials necessary to make tortillas, such as corn at wholesale, firewood, and plastic bags, this will help to strengthen the business, and to have more satisfied customers.

Her dream is to help her children study, with the contribution of the business, because this will allow them to improve their living condition in the future.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale, firewood, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh flowers and plastic materials for decorations.

loans.name: Norietta

texts.en:
This is Norietta. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her personal, household and business expenditures. She has been in this business for twelve years now.

Norietta would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in more profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and meet their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.  

Norietta dreams of continuous success in her business and hopes that all her loved ones will always have good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a lady of forty years, married to Job, and a mother of two children. She runs a grocery store and has been doing so for eight years. She earns monthly income of fifty thousand shillings.

This will be Esther's third loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to add stock to resell in her store, by buying more foods like tomatoes, eggs and fruits. She wants to diversify her business and open a retail shop, in the future.

loans.use: To buy fruits, tomatoes, eggs, and other foods to resell in her store

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simón, necesita más capital de trabajo, para iniciar el nuevo cultivo de la temporada, por eso solicita un préstamo para el pago de arrendamiento del terreno donde se dispone a realizar la siembra, esto le ayudara para tener la seguridad del terreno y realizar la siembra de maíz y camote. 
Simón considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a comprar los insumos necesarios, manteniéndose en la actividad agrícola y apoyar a su familia y sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en: Simón, needs more working capital to start to plant the new crop of the season. For that reason he is applying for a loan to pay the lease on the land where he will be able to harvest. It will help him have the security of the land and be able to harvest corn and sweet potatoes. Simón believes that the previous loan allowed him to buy the necessary supplies, to make a living on agriculture and to support his family and his children in their education.

loans.use: to pay the lease on the land.

loans.name: Digna Maribel

texts.es:
Digna, vive con su esposo y sus hijos de 17 y 18 años de edad, ella se dedica a atender un comedor y su esposo tambien trabaja, tiene más de 7 años de estar en este negocio, realizándolo todos los días de 6:00am hasta las 7:00am.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio, teniendo los insumos necesarios para fabricar los alimentos, como maíz, frijoles, arroz, aceite, azúcar, entre otros, esto le ayudara al fortalecimiento y mejoras con el negocio.
La aspiración de ella es que sus hijos tengan su apoyo para que se superen estudiando una carera académica.
texts.en:
Digna lives with her husband and children (ages 17 and 18).  She works running a restaurant.  Her husband also works.  She has been with this business for over 7 years, working every day from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm.

She is asking for a loan to buy goods for her business so that she will have the things she needs to prepare her dishes.  The goods include corn, beans, rice, oil, sugar, etc.  This will help her strengthen and improve her business.

Digna aspires to support her children's progress, studying an academic profession.

loans.use: to buy goods such as corn, beans, rice, oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Muhogo Group

texts.en:
Anna, who is in her late twenties, is single. She has been running a food vending business for three years. She works from 4 am to 4 pm daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Anna's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd. She used the previous loans to buy more stock of food, to buy a cow to produce and sell milk; and to enlarge the place where she sells her food. She has paid back all her loans successfully. With the profits earned, she has managed to buy a sofa set and cover her household expenses. She dreams of building her own house. She will use this loan to buy more stock of food and to start selling water, juice and sodas.

Anna will share this loan with her loan group "Muhogo" which has 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food and to start selling water, juice and sodas.

loans.name: Enila Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is Enila Group. The group members include 54-year-old Esther, from Mutare. She is married and has three children.  Esther runs a retail business and sells clothes and blankets. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenge she faces is late payment by customers who buy on credit.

Esther has requested a loan of $750 to purchase clothes and blankets to resell. She says the extra profit generated will allow her to improve the general welfare of her family. Esther plans to open a preschool in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes and blankets to resell in her retail business

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a 35-year-old, married woman, and a mother of four young children, from Talibon, Bohol. She and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business together, for more than 12 years. This has been the source of their income.

Angelita is asking for a loan to make part payment for purchasing a fishing boat. With the boat, they will be able to improve their fishing business and augment their income. Angelita hopes to expand their business and make it a success, in the future. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat

loans.name: Sabina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sabina, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita comprar mercadería para la venta de verduras, con esto quiere surtir de productos frescos, se comprara tomates, papas, chiles, zanahorias, entre otros productos, que le darán mejor vistosidad.
Ella comenta que trabajar con prestamos le ha permitido mejorar su condición en las ganancias,  comprando alimentación y pago de estudios de sus hijos, cuenta con salud para trabajar, con este aporte estará trabajando y fortaleciendo el negocio.
texts.en:
Sabina decided to take out another loan because she needs to buy goods for her vegetable shop.  With it, she wants to stock up on fresh produce.  She will buy tomatoes, potatoes, chiles, carrots, among other produce, which will make her shop more attractive.

She says that working with loans has allowed her to improve her situation in terms of profits, buying food and paying for her childrens' education.

She is lucky to have the health to work.  With this contribution, she will continue working and strengthening her business.

loans.use: buy goods such as tomatoes, potatoes, chiles, and carrots.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 23 years old and is married to Sammy. They are from Nakuru. They have two children, the eldest aged four years, and the younger one a six-month-old baby.

Caroline has been in the grocery business for one year, and the business is progressing on well. She has applied for her first loan, in the amount of KES 20,000, from KADET LTD. She will use it to buy grocery stock to resell, e.g., potatoes, tomatoes and other assorted vegetables.

She hopes to expand her business for both retail and wholesale, in the near future.

loans.use: to buy grocery stock to resell, e.g., potatoes, tomatoes and other assorted vegetables

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es:
Rufino, necesita un nuevo préstamo para realizar una nueva siembra de maíz y frijol, con este préstamo se pagara el arrendamiento del terreno, contando con la certeza de tener un lugar seguro donde trabajar.
El tuvo un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, le ayudo a comprarse el abono, herbicidas y todo lo más necesario para el cultivo de maíz y frijol, con esto estará teniendo una mejor condición en la familia.
texts.en:
Rufino needs a new loan to plant a new crop of corn and beans.  With this loan he will pay the rent for his land and have the certainty of having a secure place to work.

He had a positive experience with his previous loan.  It helped him buy fertilizer, weed-killer, and everything else necessary to cultivate corn and beans.  With this he will improve his family circumstances.

loans.use: pay the rent for his land.

loans.name: Ana Olivia

texts.es:
Ana, necesita realizar la compra de productos para la venta, por eso solicita un nuevo financiamiento para la compra de elotes, yuca, plátanos, tomates, repollo, esto le permitirá tener lo más necesario para la venta y así tener una fuente de ingreso.
Ella comenta que trabajar con préstamos, le ha permitido tener lo necesario para realizar el negocio, sus circunstancias familiares son mejor, en su economia ha progresado ya que ha tenido ingresos mayores.
texts.en: Ana needs to buy products to sell which is why she is seeking a new loan to be able to buy corn, yucca, plantains, tomatoes and cabbage. This will allow her to have the most necessary items to sell and that way to have a source of income. She states that working with loans has allowed her to have what is needed to maintain a business, that her family's circumstances are better, and that her income has increased with higher earnings.

loans.use: to buy corn, yucca, plantains, tomatoes and cabbage.

loans.name: Jerusalem Group

texts.en:
Sekai lives in Mutare and is 42 years old. She is a widow and mother of three children, two of whom are attending school.  Sekai runs a retail business and sells electrical gadgets and clothes. The business has been in operation for eight years. She imports her goods from South Africa, and the main challenge she faces is high customs duty at the border post.

Sekai has requested a loan of $400 to purchase clothes and electrical gadgets for her shop. With the extra income generated from her business, Sekai wishes to renovate her house. Sekai plans to have her own shop, instead of renting, in the future.

loans.use: to buy electrical gadgets and clothes to resell in her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, seeds and more.

loans.name: Adelio

texts.es:
Adelio, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo porque quiere más dinero e invertir en la nueva siembra, asegurando el terreno, por lo que los fondos préstamos serán para el arrendamiento del lugar donde se dispone a trabajar para la siembra de maíz y frijol.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, ya que los insumos que compro le permitieron mejorar el cultivo, de la cosecha logro generar ingresos para aportar al hogar y así cubrir gastos necesarios.
texts.en: Adelio made up his mind to get a new loan because he would like more money to invest in his new harvest and insuring the land. The loaned funds will be for the lease on the place where he can work the corn and bean harvest. He had a positive outcome with the previous loan because the supplies that he bought allowed him to improve his crop. He was able to generate enough income from the harvest to invest it in his home and in that way, cover living expenses.

loans.use: to pay the lease on the land.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Fannie

texts.en:
Fannie is 68 years old and married.

She has a buy and sell livestock business in the Philippines. Fannie is borrowing PHP 23,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy additional livestock to sell.

Fannie has been buying and selling of livestock for 11 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling fruits and vegetables.

Fannie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the lease on the land.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia lives at Bagumbayan. She is 59 years-old and a widow with three grown up-children. To make a living, she cooks and sells food for daily meals. She also offers rooms for rent to students. This way, she generates an income of P15,000 for her businesses. 

She is now asking for a loan of P30,000 in order to buy meat and vegetables to cook and sell and to maintain her room rental services. It will help maintain good sales and profits as well.

With good profits, Virginia will be able to save the necessary funds to develop her business and someday achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy meat and vegetables to cook and sell and to maintain her room rental services.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is 53 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living with a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Feliciana is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Feliciana has been pig fattening for 11 years and also earns additional income from coconut wine vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Noemi Del Carmen

texts.es:
Noemí, vive con sus dos hijos, un de 12 y otro de 8 años de edad, es madre soltera, se dedica a atender un pequeño taller de sastrería, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 7 años, como una forma para obtener ingresos, aprendió con una vecina.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para las costuras, como telas, repuestos para las maquinas, este le ayudara a solventar la necesidad momentánea, ya que así tendrá lo necesario para sacar lo pedido de los clientes.
Su aspiración es tener un taller más amplio, ofrecer ropa como un pequeño bazar.
texts.en: Noemí lives with her two children, ages 12 and 8. She is a single mother. She makes a living working at a small tailor's shop. She has had the business for 7 years as a way to make income. She learned from her neighbor. She is seeking a loan to buy the materials for sewing, such as fabrics and replacements for the machines. This will allow her to cover her immediate needs and in that way she will have what is necessary to be able to make what her customers order. Her wish is to have a larger workshop and to sell clothes like at a small store.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials and replacements for the machines.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 50 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising hogs in the Philippines. Elena is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc (NWTF) to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elena has been in the hog-raising business for 3 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en: Sergia is married with 9 children. She is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. Sergia is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to pay for land preparation. Sergia has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for almost 2 years.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation for corn production.

loans.name: Delmy Idalia

texts.es:
Delmy, se dedica a la venta de pescado seco, sardinas y pupusas, es una persona de hogar, vive con su hija y la abuela, es madre soltera, aprendió el negocio a través de amistades, luego lo experimento sola con gran cantidad de productos, tiene 10 años de realizar el negocio, hoy en día vende menos, pero tambien realiza la venta de pupusas.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de pescado, sardinas, tambien algunos insumos para la elaboración de pupusas, como maíz, condimentos, aceite, esto le ayudara a mejorar el negocio, ya que la temporada de mayor demanda de pescado seco aumenta, por la semana santa.
La aspiración de ella es ampliar el negocio, poder tener nuevos productos que ofrecer, tambien tener un medio para transportarse.
texts.en:
Delmy works selling dried fish, sardines, and pupusas, a traditional dish of El Salvador. She is a homebody, she lives as a single mother together with her daughter and mother. She learned this business through her friends before starting her own business and experimenting with a variety of products. She has been running her business for 10 years. She sells a smaller variety of products these days, but she still sells her pupusas.

She is applying for a loan in order to purchase fish, sardines, and ingredients for making pupusas such as corn, condiments, and oil. This will help her improve her business as the busy season for purchasing dried fish, particularly Holy Week, is approaching. Delmy's greatest aspiration is to expand her business, be able to offer more products, and also acquire a means to transport her wares.

loans.use: to purchase fish and sardines.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is an 18-year-old single man from Lebanon, a place known for friendly and welcoming people. He’s living in a house located in South Lebanon with his parent and two siblings. Kassem and his young brother cooperate together and wish to bring added income and enhance their way of living. 

This ambitious young man started his own business. His job consists of restoring computers and implementing software into them as well. He works with high professionalism and always seeks to improve his knowledge; this is why he looks today to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase added software and programs, plus perform the needed maintenance on his car that will facilitate his transportation. 

Definitely, this will boost his work and smooth his business operations. His future dreams are to be able to take bigger projects, and little by little, grow as a businessman in his domain.

loans.use: to purchase added software and programs, plus perform the needed maintenance on his car that will facilitate his transportation.

loans.name: Milagro Del Socorro

texts.es:
Milagro, necesita más capital para trabajar, por eso solicita un préstamo para fortalecer el negocio, de las pupusas, tostadas y refrescos, esto le ayudara para seguir trabajando, con el préstamo que solicita comprara una cocina industrial y otra parte en quesillo, maíz, plátanos, entre otros.
Con el préstamo anterior considera que logro fortalecer el negocio, con las ganancias a podido ayudar a su familia, el negocio ha crecido y le ha permitido tener lo necesario para su familia.
texts.en:
Milagro needs more capital to work so she is requesting a loan to strengthen her business. She sells pupusas, tostados and drinks. This loan will help her to keep working, and allow her to buy an industrial stove, and also to invest in cheese tortillas, corn, plantains, and other items.

She feels that her last loan strengthened her business. With her earnings, she was able to help her family. Her business has grown and has allowed her to provide her family with what they need.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove, cheese tortillas, corn, plantains, and other items.

loans.name: Emerald Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 42-year-old Emelder from Mutare. She is married and has four children, two attending school. Emelder runs a retail business where she sells televisions, radios, and clothes. The business has been in operation for four years. She says the main challenges faced are high transport costs and late payments from clients who buy on credit. Emelder has requested a loan of $400 USD to purchase clothes and radios for resale. With the extra income generated as a result of this loan, Elelda wishes to send her children to better schools. In the future, Emelder plans to buy her own shop.

loans.use: To buy TVs, home theatre, and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 41 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Gina wants to have a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her sugarcane farming business.

Gina has been farming sugarcane for five years and also earns additional income from hog raising. 

Gina is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Emmanuel Queens Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 27-year-old Jane from Mutare. She is married and has three children, two attending school. Jane runs a retail business and sells clothes and plates. The business has been in operation for three years. She says the main challenges faced are high transport costs and late payments from clients who buy on credit. Jane has requested a loan of $400 USD to purchase clothes and plates for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable her to afford better education for her children. In the future, Jane plans to buy her own  shop.

loans.use: To buyplates and clothes for resale in rural areas where she will exchange them for agricultural products like maize and beans

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, se decidió por invertir nuevamente en el cultivo, comprando lo necesario para poderlo realizar, abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, entre otros productos que sean muy necesarios y que le den la seguridad para tener un buen cultivo. 
Él considera que los préstamos le han permitido tener mejores cosechas en las tierras, le han servido para mejorar las circunstancias en la familia, aumentando sus ingresos.
texts.en: Victor has decided to invest once again in his harvest, which will require purchasing all the necessaries: fertilizer, insecticide, pesticide, and other products. These products are necessary and will guarantee that he will have a good crop. Victor believes that the loans have allowed him to bring in better harvests from his lands, and in doing so have increased his income and improved circumstances for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticides, pesticides and other products.

loans.name: Pedro Celestiano

texts.es:
El SR. Pedro vive en Guayaquil, tiene 64 años. El cliente comenzo como taxista pero por problemas de salud  en la actualidad no puede manejar y renta el carro para que otra persona lo condusca. 

El cliente esta casado su esposa vende unas ricas y deliciosas salchichas los días viernes, sábado y domingo, no tiene hijos menores de edad.

Con el prestamo quiere reparar ciertas partes del taxi ya que con las lluvias ha tendido problema con el motor. El sueño que quiere realizar es poder conseguir otro taxi mejor para poder seguir laborando como lo ha hecho hasta ahora.
texts.en:
Pedro lives in Guayaquil, and he is 63 years old.  He started working as a taxi driver, but because of his current health problems he cannot drive, so he rents his car to another person who drives it.

Pedro is married, and his wife has a business selling tasty and delicious sausages on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays.  He has no minor children.

With this loan, he wants to do some repairs to his taxi, because with the rains he has had some problems with the motor.  

The dream that he wants to make a reality is to get another, better taxi, so that he could continue to work as he has done up until now.

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, se decidió por continuar trabajando con préstamos, porque necesita más capital para la venta de tamales, comprando productos como frijoles, aceite, maíz, leña, y otros condimentos que son necesarios para realizar la venta.
Ella considera que los préstamos le han ayudado a fortalecer el negocio, con lo necesario ha trabajado en su venta de tamales, de las ganancias ayuda a su familia.
texts.en: María decided to continue working through loans because she needs more capital for her business selling tamales. She will purchase products such as beans, oil, corn, firewood, and condiments that are necessary for their production and sale. María believes the loans have helped to strengthen her business. With her purchases she has continued selling her tamales, and the profits help her family.

loans.use: to purchase beans, oil, corn, and firewood.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y siembra de granos básicos, El es un hombre que creció con sus padres, aprendió el trabajo de campo, vive con su esposa y un hijo, José es reconocido en la comunidad por ser un hombre trabajador, el oficio lo aprendió con sus padres, su ventaja es tener un negocio propio, pero su dificultad es la distancia desde su casa al tiangue donde se venden los cerdos.
Él quiere realizar una inversión a su granja, comprando cerdos, los cuales tendrá a su cuidado para luego venderlos, para esto solicita un préstamo ya que le ayudara mucho, incrementando sus posibilidades de tener un mejor negocio, uno de los riesgos es una enfermedad en los cerdos y el desequilibrio en los precios.
Sus sueños personales son aumentar las oportunidades de negocio, tenerlo mas rentable, que le ayude a mejorar sus condiciones de vida para la familia.
texts.en:
José works by raising pigs and planting basic grains. He is a man who was raised by his parents and learned how to work the land, which his parents taught him. He lives with his wife and son. José is well-known in the community for being a hard-working man. His advantage is in having his own business, but the most difficult aspect for him is the distance from his home to the market that sells pigs.

José wants to make an investment in his farm by buying pigs, which he will care for and then later sell. For this reason, he is requesting a loan that will help him a lot, increasing his possibilities of creating a better business. One of the risks is of the pigs getting sick and the instability of prices.

His personal dreams are to increase his business opportunities and make it more successful. This will help him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Jefferson Regulo

texts.es:
El cliente Jefferson vive en Guayaquil, tiene 33 años de edad. El empezó su negocio como aprendiz observando cómo se utilizaba las herramientas luego trabajo como empleado, actualmente es maestro soldador con la cual sustenta los gastos de su hogar.

Este trabajo lo realiza solo de 9:00 de la mañana a 6:00 de la tarde, hay veces que le dificulta la temporada invernal ya que es imposible realizar esta labor debido a las lluvias.
Está casado, su esposa ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar y no tiene hijos por lo tanto las ganancias van para su negocio, hogar y bienestar. 

Con el prestamo quiere comprar una maquina soldadora. El sueño es poder mantener un buen taller con varios empleados, compartir junto a su esposa, tener una vida cómoda sin que les falte nada.
texts.en:
Jefferson, 33, lives in Guayaquil.  He started in his line of work as an apprentice, where he observed how to use construction tools.  Later he worked as an employee, and now he is a master welder.  This is how he supports his household.

Jefferson works on his own from 9am until 6pm.  There are times when the winter weather is a problem for him, because it is impossible to do this type of work in the rain.

Jefferson is married, and his wife helps with the household chores.  They have no children, and so his earnings are used for his business, his house, and his well-being.

With this loan, he wants to buy a welding machine.  He dreams of having a good workshop with his wife, where they could have a number of employees and have a comfortable life where they have everything they need.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente vive Guayaquil, tiene 35 años de edad. Ella empezó su negocio vendiendo cosmeticos después de la muerte de su esposo. El proceso de incrementar sus ventas fue que sus amistades la apoyaron comprándole productos, después fue visitando casa por casa y promocionando más sus productos a las personas y clientes y con el dinero de los pedidos paga los gastos del hogar, le gusta lo que hace.

Ella realiza su negocio sola desde las 9:00 de la mañana hasta las 7:00 de la noche  vendiendo sus productos. No está casada, tiene un hijo de 14 años de edad que estudia en un colegio fiscal. Ella piensa mucho en su enfermedad ya que en ocasiones le afecta tanto que no puede levantarse de la cama.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cremas, ropa, cosmeticos para incrementar sus ventas. En el futuro quiere poder tener su casa propia, tener un local comercial para darles empleo a personas que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
The client lives in Guayaquil and is 35 years old. She started her business selling cosmetics after the death of her husband.

The way she increased her sales was that her friends supported her by buying products. Later, it was by going door-to-door and promoting her products more to customers and other people. With the money from the orders she pays for the household expenses, and she likes what she does. 

She carries on her business alone, selling her products from 9:00 in the morning until 7:00 in the evening. She is not married and has a 14-year-old son who goes to public school. She thinks a great deal about her illness, as sometimes it affects her so much that she can't get out of bed. 

With the loan she wants to buy creams, clothing and cosmetics, in order to increase her sales. In the future she wants to be able to have her own house and to have a shop, so that she can give work to people who need it.

loans.use: To buy creams, clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ana Marisol

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo y sus hijos de 10 y 7 años de edad, vive con la madre de su esposo y una cuñada, solamente sus hijos les provee lo necesario junto con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos, lleva el nombre de uno de sus hijos, tiene más de 3 años en el negocio, ofrece pupusas, papas fritas, lo realiza todos los días. 
Ella necesita realizar la inversión comprando productos como salchichas, pollo, repollo, pan, entre otros productos, esto le ayudara a tener fortalecido el negocio, para obtener mejores ventas.
La aspiración de Ana es que sus hijos puedan estudiar y superarse, ya que les ayudara para tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and her two children who are ages ten and seven. She also lives with her mother-in-law and a sister-in-law. She and her husband provide solely for their children. Ana works selling snacks from her cart, which bears the name of one of her children. She has managed this business for more than three years, offering pupusas (a traditional dish of El Salvador) and french fries, which she makes everyday. Ana needs to invest in purchasing products such as sausage, chicken, cabbage, bread, and other items which will help her keep her business strong and improve her sales. 

Ana's main aspiration is to have her children study and get ahead in life as she helps them to have a better future.

loans.use: Para comprar salchichas, pollo, repollo, pan entre otros productos.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Carmen de 50 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos los cuales dependen de ella, es responsable y trabajadora tiene su negocio de venta de tortillas ubicado en su lugar de residencia, solicita un credito para poder comprar mas maiz y tenerlo almacenado y asi poder seguir vendiendo sus tortillas ya que es el unico recurso que tiene para poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Doña Carmen is 50 years old and lives together with her husband and two dependent children. She is responsible, hardworking, and manages a business selling tortillas out of her home. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase and stock more corn so she can continue selling her tortillas. These sales are now her only source of income to allow her to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: acquire working capital.

loans.name: Jose Cristobal

texts.es:
José, vive con sus hijos y su esposa, quienes dependen de él, José se dedica a la ganadería, trabajando con su hijo, no tiene un horario de trabajo, se ha dedicado a la crianza, compra y venta del ganado.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de dos vacas con terneros, esto le ayudara a incrementar la ganadería y darle un mejor mantenimiento a su negocio, aumentando la producción de leche y ganado.
José desea tener su propio rancho con el ganado, donde tener más espacio para la ganadería.
texts.en: José lives with his children and wife, who depend on him. José raises cattle, working with his son on his own schedule to raise, buy, and sell cattle. He is seeking this loan to buy two cows and their calves, which will help him to increase his production of milk and saleable cattle, allowing him to make his business more stable. José hopes to have his own cattle ranch, where he'll have more space for his herd.

loans.use: to buy two cows and their calves.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 56 years old and married with six children.

Lucresia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like bread, shampoo, biscuits, soft drinks, and other groceries, in her general store.
